As an AI language model, I don't have access to the latest news or updates specific to Liga I. However, I can provide some examples of virtual initiatives adopted globally by football clubs to engage with their fans during the pandemic:

1. Virtual Matchdays: With matches being played behind closed doors, many clubs have come up with innovative ways to connect with their fans during matches. Some clubs have provided a virtual matchday experience, which includes interactive features like live updates, real-time chats, and interactive in-game experiences.

2. Club-branded apps: Clubs have started launching club-branded apps where fans can access exclusive content such as virtual tours, behind-the-scenes footage, stats, and match highlights. The apps are also used to connect with fans through social media while providing news updates on club activities.

3. Online fitness classes: With most fitness studios closed, some clubs have created online fitness classes such as yoga or home workout videos for their fans to follow along. This initiative promotes an active lifestyle among their fan base.

4. Zoom Q&A sessions: Some clubs have organized virtual Q&A sessions with players where fans can submit questions through social media, and players answer them live on Zoom calls.

5. Virtual Fan Walls: Some clubs have created virtual fan walls where fans can upload photos of themselves supporting the club, and their pictures are displayed on a screen within the stadium during matches.

Overall, these initiatives show how clubs have adapted to keep their fans engaged and connected during the pandemic, and similar initiatives may have been adopted by Liga I clubs to engage with their fans while following social distancing norms.
